banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: The importance of good conversation – and how to have it
videoData.socialTitle: The importance of good conversation – and how to have it

nodes.whoTheyAre: John O'Leary thinks that we don’t take our conversations in business seriously. Within his role as director of communications of State Street’s business transformation programs, he seeks to remove the barriers that prevent healthy conversation in business. O’Leary is also co-authour of the 2009 best-selling book, “If We Can Put a Man on the Moon” and his writings have appeared in The Wall Street Journal and The Washington Post, among others.

videoData.description: The night before the Challenger exploded, NASA had a three-hour conference call with a company that knew the shuttle would fail. Why did NASA not abort the mission? John O'Leary explores what makes for an effective conversation. He lists three myths that can lead to destructive silence, and vital techniques to enable good conversation for groups everywhere.
videoData.socialDescription: The night before the Challenger exploded, NASA had a three-hour conference call with a company that knew the shuttle would fail. Why did NASA not abort the mission? John O'Leary explores what makes for an effective conversation. He lists three myths that can lead to destructive silence, and vital techniques to enable good conversation for groups everywhere.
